channel.title: Wildy in and out thingy

item.title: Wildy in and out thingy
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“dipset4lyf, post:1, topic:146708”]some tell me how to make this tut work so when u enter wildy it shows skull and when u get out its doesnt show skull

public void WriteWildyLevel() { checkwildy2(); if(inwildy2 && !nonWild()) { outStream.createFrame(208); outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); sendQuest("@red@Danger!", 199); leftwild = 1; } else if(nonWild() && inwildy2 && leftwild == 1) { IsSnowing = 3; leftwild = 0; } }[/quote]

Firstly, please… Explain more…

Secondly, its not a tut…

Thirdly, please refrain from using stupid text in your titles… Wildy in and out thingy?..

What does that explain?.. And last of all, you didn’t make it… Your gonna trust sumit from a source, it would be easier to make your own.

Read full topic

item.title: Wildy in and out thingy
item.dc:creator: @dipset4lyf dipset4lyf
item.description:
@dipset4lyf wrote:

some tell me how to make this tut work so when u enter wildy it shows skull and when u get out its doesnt show skull

public void WriteWildyLevel() { checkwildy2(); if(inwildy2 && !nonWild()) { outStream.createFrame(208); outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); sendQuest("@red@Danger!", 199); leftwild = 1; } else if(nonWild() && inwildy2 && leftwild == 1) { IsSnowing = 3; leftwild = 0; } }
